candidates.title: Rocket v0.5.0 + MSRV
candidates.body:
- Using Rocket v0.5.0
- Set MSRV to v1.56 (same as Rocket's), per #83

candidates.title: Update to latest master Rocket version (#89)
Bump Rocket version
candidates.body: There were apparently changes to use the new Rocket version, but it didn't actually bump the version. This change fixes that.

candidates.title: Update to work with latest Rocket RC
candidates.body:
The following changes were made:
- Satisfying the `#[must_use]` annotation on the `Rocket` struct where
  necessary (mostly in test code)
- Adding the `http` crate for the `HeaderName` type
    - Rocket no longer exports all of `hyper` or `http`
      indescriminately, so we have to be more mindful of types from
      either crate that we require. Thus, this commit adds the `http`
      crate to satisfy the requirement.
- Updated tests to properly return a result from a launched `Rocket`

candidates.title: feat: update rust edition from 2018 to 2021
candidates.body:
- Ran `cargo fix —edition`
- Changed `edition` in `Cargo.toml` to __2021__
- Tests were all ok

Would you mind updating the crate on crates.io? The last release was in march, since some commits were made which are important for devs using the rocket rc

candidates.title: Update to Rocket 0.5-rc.1
candidates.body: Just as it says. Use the 0.5-rc.1 version of Rocket.

candidates.title: Resolve Tokio Dependency conflicy
candidates.body:
Pull request #91 updated to a version of Rocket which specified a tokio version <= 1.6.0
More recent rocket commits to master have since specified v1.6.1.

This causes version conflicts when attempting to install rocket-cors with the latest version of Rocket.
This fix pushes the version of rocket specified to after the tokio version change, fixing the conflict.

candidates.title: Update to latest Rocket master
candidates.body:
- Update all instances of `State<T>` to borrow and drop anonymous lifetime
- Remove examples showing returning a `Response` instead of a `Responder`
  since `Response` no longer implements `Responder`

candidates.title: Update to latest master Rocket version
candidates.body:
Because of some change in rocket's master branch, currently this library cannot be use with rocket's master branch. This PR update the library to be compatible with latest rocket's master branch.

### Changes
- Rocket phase have changed to Build -> Ignite -> Orbit
  - `rocket::ignite()`(which was previously the first phase) are now replaced by `rocket::build()`
  - `rocket::Rocket` now have one type parameter signifying the phase
- Replace fairing's `on_attach()` with `on_ignite()` 
  - some of fairing's test are change to test when rocket are on ignite phase.
- Replace `rocket::handler` with `rocket::route`
  -  `rocket::route::Handler` don't have the same lifetime signature as (now removed)`rocket::handler::Handler`
- `rocket::log_` are removed
- Replace `rocket::Request::get_param()` with `rocket::Request::param()`
- Multiple segment now matched empty path (previously the route `"/<p..>"` won't match `"/"` but now it will). this change cause the routes returned from `catch_all_options_routes()` to collide so I remove the empty route.

candidates.title: fix: Update to latest master Rocket version
candidates.body:
Rocket's master branch, being in development, has changed since the last update to this repository. This commit aims to update the library to the latest and greatest changes in the rocket library.

# Changes
- Rocket's error type no longer implements `std::error::Error` so we have to drop it to handle it. ? no longer works (https://github.com/lawliet89/rocket_cors/pull/85/files#diff-34e1d5b1622d3e67a0a29f3eb36c7800448dd04e3054be57c108b27d6a0f3953L30)
- `Client::new` has been superseeded by `Client::tracked` and `Client::untracked`. I have replaced all instances of `Client::new` with `Client::tracked` since that is historically how `Client::new` worked (https://github.com/lawliet89/rocket_cors/pull/85/files#diff-5123f34e46e91dd8a37c00eba3092c0036b6374267317a73db1507ce0eb5453aL174)
- Renamed the `cors` route to `cors_responder` since rust was unhappy that it was named cors. Here are the errors so you can see: 
    - ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14093962/97218075-8cd56900-179e-11eb-8d1b-18f85d0c3610.png)
I have decided to just rename the route since it was the easiest.
(https://github.com/lawliet89/rocket_cors/pull/85/files#diff-5123f34e46e91dd8a37c00eba3092c0036b6374267317a73db1507ce0eb5453aL191)
- Removed call to `inspect` on the rocket type since it has been removed (https://github.com/lawliet89/rocket_cors/pull/85/files#diff-5123f34e46e91dd8a37c00eba3092c0036b6374267317a73db1507ce0eb5453aL191)
- Changed type in fairing to match the new type in rocket (https://github.com/lawliet89/rocket_cors/pull/85/files#diff-5123f34e46e91dd8a37c00eba3092c0036b6374267317a73db1507ce0eb5453aL118)

candidates.title: Use async version from rocket's master branch
candidates.body:
* use hyper re-export from rocket_http
* switch rocket version to master branch
  (use release version once async is available)
* adapt code to incorporate changes from rocket and hyper

This fixes #79.

Update:
* make Clippy happy again
* make crate compile on Rust stable
* fix GitHub CI build
